meanings.definition: To be partially covered by something else.
meanings.sent1: The small rock underlapped the fallen leaves.
meanings.sent2: The blanket underlapped the edge of the bed.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to hide underlapped the tablecloth.
meanings.sent4: Her voice underlapped the noise of the passing cars.
meanings.sent5: The shadow underlapped the sunlight, creating a contrast.

meanings.definition: To extend or lie beneath something else.
meanings.sent1: The roots of the tree underlapped the surface of the soil.
meanings.sent2: The river underlapped the bridge, flowing peacefully.
meanings.sent3: The story seemed to underlapped the reality of the situation.
meanings.sent4: His kindness underlapped his tough exterior.
meanings.sent5: The melody underlapped the lyrics, enhancing the song's beauty.
